EmailTemplate.subject: Pivotal Cloud Foundry 1.6 Now Available
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Week of November 2, 2015 <https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/pivotal-cloud-foundry-1-6-now-available?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-11-2-15> Pivotal Cloud Foundry 1.6 Now Available Looking at the similarities for the most successful software companies, there are three development tenets they embrace to achieve true agility: microservices, continuous delivery and DevOps. The latest release of Pivotal Cloud FoundryⓇ (PCF) packages modern Cloud Native software development tools into a turnkey platform. With a new library of core microservices called Spring Cloud Services, expanded support for .NET and Docker deployments, and built-in CI/CD toolchain with support for Cloudbees Jenkins, GitLab, and Jfrog Artifactory, it’s never been easier for enterprise teams to convert to Cloud Native patterns for development, testing, and operations. READ MORE <https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/pivotal-cloud-foundry-1-6-now-available?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-11-2-15> Podcasts Talking Pivotal Cloud Foundry 1.6 With James Watters November 4, 2015 With a new version of Pivotal Cloud Foundry <https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/pivotal-cloud-foundry-1-6-now-available> out, I wanted to catch up with James Watters to discuss what our customers are up to. We discuss the focus on application architecture and development that we’ve been seeing out in the field. Last we talked, much of the focus was on the infrastructure layer, and while this release has plenty of that, Spring Boot <http://projects.spring.io/spring-boot/> and Spring Cloud <http://projects.spring.io/spring-cloud/> are some of the more interesting features in this release. So, we discuss the more developer-centric context that PCF is running around in now. Tune In <https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/features/talking-pivotal-cloud-foundry-1-6-with-james-watters?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-11-2-15> EMA Cloud Analytics Survey November 4, 2015 The pace of change for designing and implementing analytical environments such as data warehouses, data marts and data vaults is accelerating. How does your organization meet these changing conditions with cloud-based implementation strategies? Enterprise Management Associates (EMA) and Pivotal invite you to participate in an end-user research study <http://info.pivotal.io/qeJI0C00NW0A0r02U00V000> on the adoption and impact of cloud-based strategies implementing analytical environments. Take Survey <http://v2.decipherinc.com/survey/selfserve/1510/151001?list=16?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-11-2-15> Big Data Introducing Greenplum: World's First Open Source
MPP Data Warehouse October 28, 2015
Today, Pivotal unveiled the first massively parallel processing (MPP) data warehouse to open source. The release of Greenplum Database is significant for two important reasons. First, while it is the only open source option for data warehousing, it also leads the industry with query optimization technology that is multiple times faster than any other commercial offering today. Second, it completes Pivotal's 10 month transition to engage more openly with all the communities we affect—and helping companies of all types on their digital transformation journey.
